title: How to Catch Eevee in Pokémon Black/White 2: Complete Guide

steps.title: Go to Castelia City.
steps.content: Go to Castelia City. It is a big city that you can reach by boat from Virbank City. This is the only place you can catch Eevee in the game. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Buy a lot of Poké Balls because you'll probably need extras.
steps.content: Buy a lot of Poké Balls because you'll probably need extras. Eevee has a low catch rate, so you’ll want to have spare Pokeballs just in case the first one doesn’t catch them. If it's night, bring Dusk Balls to use as well. Try using a Quick Ball on the first turn if you have some. Quick Balls work best at the beginning of the battle. If you've already caught an Eevee, use a Repeat Ball. You know you've caught it when there is a Poké Ball next to its name.

steps.title: Head right and go onto the dock closest to Skyarrow Bridge.
steps.content: Head right and go onto the dock closest to Skyarrow Bridge. Once you arrive in Castelia City, take a right and head to the dock that’s closest to Skyarrow Bridge. There will be a small deck attached to the dock.​​ [2] X Research source

steps.title: Once you’re on the dock, go to the small deck and down the stairs.
steps.content: Once you’re on the dock, go to the small deck and down the stairs. This will take you to the Castelia Sewers. Bear in mind, if you haven't been here before, Iris will be there and so will Hugh, your rival. So be sure to come here again after that point in the story. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Go up and follow the path until you see a left turn.
steps.content: Go up and follow the path until you see a left turn. Take the Castelia Sewers until you reach a turning point. If you haven’t been here already, you’ll need to fight Plasma Grunts while you make your way. Once you beat them, turn left and you will be greeted with a set of stairs. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Go up the stairs and walk to the Castelia Gardens.
steps.content: Go up the stairs and walk to the Castelia Gardens. You will see a small garden with a tree and a guy standing next to it after going up the stairs. The guy there says that it was the beginning for Castelia City. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Walk through the grass until you find an Eevee.
steps.content: Walk through the grass until you find an Eevee. Eevee has only a 5% chance of appearing in the grass. The other Pokémon that can be found there are: Audino (shaking grass), Lilligant (White 2), Buneary (Black 2), Cottonee (Black 2), Whimsicott (Black 2), Delcatty (White 2) Pidove (White 2 and Black 2), Lopunny (Black 2), Petilil (White 2), Rattata and Skitty (White 2). [6] X Research source It is disheartening, but don't give up. It may take a while but you will eventually find one. Only then will you be able to catch it. You can only find it at level 18 and higher.

steps.title: When you're in battle with the Eevee, lower its health to about 7%.
steps.content: When you're in battle with the Eevee, lower its health to about 7%. Once the Eevee’s health is down to 7&, use a Poké Ball on it. You're unlikely to catch it the first time, so be patient. An Ultra Ball gives a higher catch rate than an ordinary Poké Ball. [7] X Research source Have a Pokémon with a move that inflicts a status effect such as paralysis or sleep. This will make it easier to catch. Don't use moves that poison or confuse the other Pokémon or it could die by accident.

steps.title: After beating the game, go to Fennel and Amanita’s lab in Castelia City.
steps.content: After beating the game, go to Fennel and Amanita’s lab in Castelia City. Once you beat the Elite Four, go to the north part of Castelia City and go inside the building across the street from Castelia Gym. Head to the 3rd floor to get to Fennel and Amanita’s lab. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Once you’re in the lab, talk to Amanita for an Eevee.
steps.content: Once you’re in the lab, talk to Amanita for an Eevee. Locate Amanita (the one with brown hair and short pigtails) and talk to her. After you make it through the prompts, Amanita will grant you an Eevee with its hidden ability. This hidden ability carries over even if you evolve the Eevee. [9] X Research source Eevee’s hidden ability is Anticipation, which will make it shudder if an opponent uses a high-damage ability. This gives it a better chance of survival.

steps.title: No, you can’t catch Eevee in the original Black/White games.
steps.content: No, you can’t catch Eevee in the original Black/White games. Eevee is only available in Black 2 and White 2, along with other Pokemon games. If you bought the original Black/White games in hopes of catching Eevee, it’s best to return them or trade them in for the second installment in the series.
